1930
1929 in comics
1931 in comics

Notable events of 1930 in comics. See also List of years in comics.

Events and publications[edit]

This literature-related list is incomplete; you can help by expanding it.

January[edit]

  • January 10: Quick & Flupke by Hergé debuts in Le Petit Vingtième. [1]
  • January: Mickey Mouse by Win Smith [2] and Ub Iwerks.[3] Five months later, Floyd Gottfredson takes over.[4]

May[edit]

  • May 8: As the first The Adventures of Tintin story reaches its conclusion in Le Petit Vingtième and has Tintin return from the USSR to Brussels the magazine's editors stage Tintin's return in real life with an actor and a dog. To their amazement the railway station's square is crowded with readers, making everybody realize that Tintin has become a success. Hergé is quickly encouraged to start a new Tintin story. [5]

June[edit]

  • June 7: The Little King by Otto Soglow debuts in The New Yorker.
  • June 7: Cancellation of the Chinese comics magazine Shanghai Manhua.[6]
  • June 15: Rea Irvin's The Smythes makes its debut in The New York Herald Tribune and will run until 25 October 1936. [7]

September[edit]

  • September 8: Blondie by Chic Young makes its debut.[8]

October[edit]

  • October 5: Tobias Seicherl by Ladislaus Kmoch debuts in the Austrian newspaper Das Kleine Blatt.[9]

November[edit]

  • November 1: Nero and Zero by Allan Morley debuts in The Wizard.[10]

Specific date unknown[edit]

  • Animal Crackers by Lane.
  • He Done Her Wrong by Milt Gross.
  • Joe Palooka by Ham Fisher.
  • Pier Cloruro de' Lambicchi by Giovanni Manca debuts in Il Corriere dei Piccoli.
  • Pitche by Alek Stonkus debuts in Le Bon Pint Amusant.[11]
  • Rymy-Eetu (1930-1973) by Erkki Tanttu.[12]
  • Scorchy Smith (1930-1961) by John Terry.

Deaths[edit]

January[edit]

  • January 3: Clare Briggs, American comics artist (A. Piker Clerk, Mr. and Mrs., When A Feller Needs A Friend), dies at age 54.[13]

June[edit]

  • June 24: Alfaro Reijding, Dutch illustrator, lithographer and comics artist, dies at age 77. [14]

October[edit]

  • October 19: Henry Gerbault, French illustrator, painter and cartoonist passes away at age 67. [15]

December[edit]

  • December 26: Kin Hubbard, American comics artist (Abe Martin of Brown County), dies at age 62.[16]

Specific date unknown[edit]

  • Johann Bahr, German painter, illustrator and comics artist (made early text comics for Fliegende Blätter, dies at age 70 or 71. [17]
  • Rolf Kluge, Norwegian comics artist (Per en Else, Skibsreder Jobbenheim og Sølvmine, continued Skomakker Bekk of Tvillingene Hans), dies at age 48.
